column3: I care not for what this says, will edit to anything people think makes sense.
We can use OSX 10.8+, as we're supporting 10.8+ and testing up to latest which is currently 10.12.2.
+1. Also I think the XP notice has been well served in previous versions.
Yes, makes sense to trim this down, everyone knows this by now.
ACK dc05406 . Think this is good now.
If someone finds more typos, feel free to just fixup them on the draft version: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/0.14.0-Release-notes
no need to mention release date.
Maybe mention that there are known instabilities/bugs on XP, which are not going to be fixed.
Apparently the OS is now called "macOS".
Isn't this line redundant at this point as well?
